column4: A message comes up saying: The instaler encountered an error copying files to the hard disk: [Errno 5] input/output error. - This is often due to a faulty CD/DVD disk or drive, or a faulty hard disk....
Any advice?
I was able to get linux mint up and running, so its not a hard drive issue?
How can I run a check to verify its md5?
Its a DVD-R CD.
Thanks guys, going to try the lower speed and see what happens. I had an older linix mint version on a CD I was able to install onto the desktop, so doesn't look like an HD issue.
How do I load up terminal in 11.04? I'm a noob and been running 10. somthing for a looong time.
Thanks guys.
Thats very true. The main reason while I'll never change back to Windows.
I'm on my works computer (sadly they run windows) is InfraRecorder any good when it comes to burning disks?
its great. Remember to burn as slowly as possible
its not cli based
the keyring isn't used for updates. That's your login password
got ya! Although everytime I try and install new apps and stuff I'm asked for a password, anyway for me to turn that off?
no, not in ubuntu
which video chip?
try the boot option: nouveau.blacklist=1
did you install the nvidia proprietary driver?
nope I didn't,
Just can't boot now, nothing will load on my screen.
try the nouveau.blacklist=1 option
hold SHIFT at boot is a start
would it work if I just do a fresh install via cd then insall the driver?
sure but you already have the install. If you boot to root recovery mode you can just run:  sudo apt-get install nvidia-current      and it will install
